result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher Alexander Moses

records.addlTxt:
1:50 PM Defendant Christopher Alexander Moses in court.  Attorney Scott H Lyon in court for Christopher Alexander Moses.  Attorney Kathryn E Heineck in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court calls cases 21CF240 and 22CF53.
Atty Lyon provides plea form.
ADA heard on agreement.
Atty Lyon agrees.
Victim rights compliance.
Court arraigns Deft on Count 1 of 21CF240.
Deft enters a plea of guilty.
Non-citizen advisory.
PleaQuest/WOR.
Constitutional rights.
Read-ins.
Deft understands.
Elements of offense.
Atty Lyon satisfied.
Factual basis.
Court finds Deft enters plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently; therefore court accepts plea and finds Deft guilty to Count 1 of 21CF240.
Court dismisses and reads-in Counts 1, 2, and 3 of 22CF53.
Court orders presentence investigation be completed.  Agent to provide report to court at least 10 days prior to sentencing. 
2:04 PM off record.
2:05 back on record.
Court schedules with parties.
Court orders deft to cooperate with the PSI process.
Court orders deft to go to the DOC office today, to schedule the PSI.
No firearms.
May not vote or serve on jury until civil rights are restored.
Court removes the PTC scheduled for July 14, 2022 from the court's calendar.
Court removes the Jury Trial scheduled for July 19 & 20, 2022 from the court's calendar.
2:06 PM
Atty Scott Lyon appointed as Dean atty - repayment by Deft of $100 per mth to be combined with current payment plan on 21CF240 as ordered on 8-21-21

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: Ltr from JA to Deft regarding Dean atty

03:57 PM Defendant Christopher Alexander Moses in court with attorney Scott Lyon.  Kathryn E Heineck appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court heard on off record discussion regarding order for appointment of counsel - atty Lyon will file paperwork ASAP.
Atty Lyon - waiver today, provides form, signed, reviewed and satisfied.
Court reviews from w/Deft.
Deft waives prelim.
Court finds Deft freely waives prelim, finds probable cause and binds over for trial.
Court heard on possible arraignment today.
ADA confirms information will track comp - will file today.
Atty Lyon - based on info tracking comp, waives reading, enters n/g pleas, requests STC.
Court schedules w/parties.
4:02 pm
  Status conference scheduled for May 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

11:36 AM Defendant Christopher Alexander Moses in court with attorney .  Kathryn E Heineck appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court calls case.
Copy of complaint.
Atty Lyon heard - has reviewed complaint with deft.
Deft understands.
Requests prelim within time limits.
ADA heard on bond recommendations.
Atty Lyon heard.
Court imposes $500 cash bail w/ conditions; sign waiver of extradition, absolute sobriety, no possession or consumption of alcohol or controlled substances, including anything illegal in WI w/o a valid Rx.
Court schedules with parties.
11:39 AM
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 9, 2022 at 03:45 pm.
